description: Yagami Kazuma was originally part of the Kannagi family, a respected family of fire users who have an affinity to fire. However, after being easily defeated by his cousin Ayano and having no talent whatsoever in fire magic, Kazuma is banished and casted out from his family. 4 years later, Kazuma finally returns to Japan, this time as an exceptionally powerful wind user. A series of murders on Kannagi family members have occurred with his arrival. While most of the family including Ayano is convinced Kazuma is the culprit, he honestly isn't. These events begin an all out war against the Kannagi family, with Kazuma and Ayano right in the middle of it. Based on the novel by Takahiro Yamato.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Incest
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations between characters who are related by blood.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Coastal
tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Fairy
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a fairy.

tags.name: Clone
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an artificial exact copy of another organism.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

node.description:
__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"
Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). He is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).
Background Artist affiliated with studio Stereotype Smartile.

[Twitter 1](https://twitter.com/i/user/1030757741193646080) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/i/user/1467985113997021188) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtOegRvxx7rZNiIsMyEPIfA) | [Website](https://www.hidetoshiohmori19591105.com/)

After graduation, Oomori moved to Tokyo and began his career at Studio Annapuru in 1981, a small sub-contracting studio founded by [Osamu Dezaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100393/) and [Akio Sugino](https://anilist.co/staff/103064/). Soon after he left the studio and joined Bebow, a studio ran by [Tomonori Kogawa](https://anilist.co/staff/105957/). There he mainly worked on mecha shows produced by [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/). He also showed up as an animation director on [Urusei Yatsura](https://anilist.co/anime/1293/).

Oomori left Bebow in 1986, and participated in the establishment of Atelier Giga. Around this time he also served as an animation director on [Mobile Suit Gundam: Char's Counterattack](https://anilist.co/anime/87/), one of his best-known works.

In the '90s he was also active in the video game industry. Notably as an animation director on Final Fantasy VII.

[Twitter 1](https://twitter.com/i/user/1030757741193646080) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/i/user/1467985113997021188) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtOegRvxx7rZNiIsMyEPIfA) | [Website](https://www.hidetoshiohmori19591105.com/)

After graduation, Oomori moved to Tokyo and began his career at Studio Annapuru in 1981, a small sub-contracting studio founded by [Osamu Dezaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100393/) and [Akio Sugino](https://anilist.co/staff/103064/). Soon after he left the studio and joined Bebow, a studio ran by [Tomonori Kogawa](https://anilist.co/staff/105957/). There he mainly worked on mecha shows produced by [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/). He also showed up as an animation director on [Urusei Yatsura](https://anilist.co/anime/1293/).

Oomori left Bebow in 1986, and participated in the establishment of Atelier Giga. Around this time he also served as an animation director on [Mobile Suit Gundam: Char's Counterattack](https://anilist.co/anime/87/), one of his best-known works.

In the '90s he was also active in the video game industry. Notably as an animation director on Final Fantasy VII.

Ilustrator and Director specialized in OPs and Game Cutscenes. 

His work stands out for the vibrant color schemes, prominent character animation and tendency to interlace different portions of the screen.

**Notable works outside anime:**

- Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 3 (Videogame, 2006) (OP Director, Animation Cutscene Director, Animation Director)
- Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 3 - Portable (Videogame, 2009) (OP Director, OP Animation Director, OP Editing)
